text: The 1964 San Francisco Giants season was the Giants' 82nd year in Major League Baseball, their seventh year in San Francisco since their move from New York following the 1957 season, and their fifth at Candlestick Park. The team finished in fourth place, as a result of their 90–72 record, placing them three games behind the National League and World Series Champion St. Louis Cardinals. == Offseason == * October 1, 1963: Jimmie Coker was traded by the Giants to the St. Louis Cardinals for Ken MacKenzie.Jimmie Coker at Baseball- Reference * October 10, 1963: Jack Fisher was drafted from the Giants by the New York Mets in a 1963 special draft.Jack Fisher at Baseball-Reference * March 29, 1964: Joey Amalfitano was purchased from the Giants by the Chicago Cubs.Joey Amalfitano at Baseball-Reference * April 14, 1964: Duke Snider was purchased by the Giants from the New York Mets === Spring training === The Giants held spring training games at Phoenix Municipal Stadium, which opened in 1964. In the first game at Phoenix Muni on March 8, 1964, the Giants beat Cleveland, 6 to 2. Willie Mays hit the first home run at the park, in front of a crowd of 8,582. In attendance for the dedication ceremonies were Commissioner Ford Frick, National League President Warren Giles, and Giants owner Horace Stoneham. == Regular season == === Season standings === === Record vs. opponents === === Opening Day starters === *Orlando Cepeda *Jim Davenport *Tom Haller *Jim Ray Hart *Harvey Kuenn *Juan Marichal *Willie Mays *Willie McCovey *José Pagánhttp://www.baseball- almanac.com/teamstats/roster.php?y=1964&t;=SFN === Roster === {| class="toccolours" style="font-size: 95%;" |- !
